comments:
Build ID: M20060921-0945

Steps To Reproduce:
1. First open of eclipse - setting workspace - eclipse starts - php explorer works fine
2. Second open of eclipse - last edited project opens - php explorer fails


More information:
I have 'tested' this bug on Ubuntu 6.06, 6.10, 7.04a and on Windows XP.
On Windows PDT works fine and fast. Unfortunately I cannot say that about Linux version. In all versions mentioned above there is the same problem.
After second start of eclipse PHP Explorer returns NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR.

.projectOptions file:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<phpProjectOptions>
	<projectOption name="org.eclipse.php.core.contextRoot">
	</projectOption>
	<projectOption name="org.eclipse.php.core.defaultEncoding">
	</projectOption>
	<includepath>
	</includepath>
</phpProjectOptions>
end of .projectOptions file

Error details:

Piotr ,
Can you check out the new relase? you are working with an old one, I hope it is not going to reproduce in the new versions (we have made major imrovement in the PHPProjectOptions)

Bests,

Well. I downloaded PDT from zend.com/pdt.

Exactly it is:
http://downloads.zend.com/pdt/all-in-one/pdt-0.7.0.I20070226_debugger-0.1.7-all-in-one-linux-gtk.tar.gz

I presume that I20070226 in file name is a date. If so then it should be the newest one. Is it true? If I am wrong please tell me from where and which file I can download.

I would prefer that you use: 
http://downloads.zend.com/pdt/all-in-one/pdt-0.7.0.I20070226_debugger-0.1.7-all-in-one-linux-gtk.tar.gz

it is the last relase and it is the closeset one to the final release.
Can you reproduce the bug on these versions? if no I will close the bug.

Bests,
Maybe I wasn't clear enough. Bug appeared in the version I have downloaded. So bug is produced on last version of PDT.

Hi,

After installing Eclipse on Debian Etch, I've the same problem (with RC3 and the nightly build). 
After switching gcj to Sun Java, it's ok (don't forget to change symbolic link in /etc/alternatives)

gij --version
java version "1.4.2"
gij (GNU libgcj) version 4.1.2 20061115 (prerelease) (Debian 4.1.1-20)


./java -version
java version "1.5.0_10"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_10-b03)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_10-b03, mixed mode, sharing)

Hope that can help !

Have the same problem using this version on a fresh eclipse install from eclipse.org with Ubuntu 7.04.
http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/tools/pdt/downloads/drops/S20070401-RC3/all-in-one/pdt-all-in-one-S20070401_RC3-linux-gtk.tar.gz

I'm getting the message after i've imported some files into an existing php project and have restarted.

Michael,
Looks like you are right. I have done (Ubuntu 7.04):
1) sudo update-alternatives --config java
2) Select "/usr/lib/jvm/java-6-sun/jre/bin/java"
3) Add "export JAVA_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/java-6-sun" to /home/username/.bashrc
4) Log out and in

Now PDT works fine.

I've found this solution on Aptana's forum.

traces.message: NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: The implementation does not support the requested type of object or operation.
